definitions.definition: The master of a house; the head of a family; a householder.
A tiller of the ground; a husbandman.
A man in a marriage or marital relationship, especially in relation to his spouse.
definitions.example: You should start dating so you can find a suitable husband.

definitions.definition: The male of a pair of animals.
A manager of property; one who has the care of another's belongings, owndom, or interests; a steward; an economist.
A large cushion with arms meant to support a person in the sitting position.
definitions.example: While reading her book, Sally leaned back against her husband, wishing it were the human kind.

definitions.definition: To manage or administer carefully and frugally; use to the best advantage; economise.
definitions.example: For my means, I'll husband them so well, / They shall go far. — Shakespeare.

definitions.definition: To engage or act as a husband to; assume the care of or responsibility for; accept as one's own.
